short_description: SQL/MR function to train a Fellegi-Sunter model
long_description: SQL/MR function to train a Fellegi-Sunter model

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the object pairs and their field-pair similarity values
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the object pairs and their field-pair similarity values

argument_clauses.name: TagColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: If you specify this argument, then the function uses supervised learning; if you omit it, then the function uses unsupervised learning. This argument specifies the name of the column that indicates whether two objects match. The column must contain only the values 'M' (matched) and 'U' (unmatched).
argument_clauses.description: If you specify this argument, then the function uses supervised learning; if you omit it, then the function uses unsupervised learning. This argument specifies the name of the column that indicates whether two objects match. The column must contain only the values 'M' (matched) and 'U' (unmatched).

argument_clauses.name: ComparisonFields
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the columns of input_table to use in the field-pair similarity in the training process. If the value in the column is less than threshold_value, then the field pair does not agree; otherwise, the field pair agrees. The default value of threshold_value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the columns of input_table to use in the field-pair similarity in the training process. If the value in the column is less than threshold_value, then the field pair does not agree; otherwise, the field pair agrees. The default value of threshold_value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: InitialM
argument_clauses.rDescription: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of m, which is the probability that a field agrees, given that the object-pair belongs to the same object. The default value is 0.9. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of m, which is the probability that a field agrees, given that the object-pair belongs to the same object. The default value is 0.9. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.

argument_clauses.name: InitialU
argument_clauses.rDescription: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of u, which is the probability that a field agrees, given that the object-pair belongs to a different object. The default value is 0.1. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of u, which is the probability that a field agrees, given that the object-pair belongs to a different object. The default value is 0.1. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.

argument_clauses.name: InitialP
argument_clauses.rDescription: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of p, which is the percentage of all possible object-pairs that contain the same object. The default value is 0.1. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the initial value of p, which is the percentage of all possible object-pairs that contain the same object. The default value is 0.1. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIteration
argument_clauses.rDescription: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the maximum number of iterations. The default value is 100. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the maximum number of iterations. The default value is 100. For supervised learning, the function ignores this argument.

argument_clauses.name: Eta
argument_clauses.rDescription: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the tolerance of the termination criterion. At the end of each iteration, the function computes the difference between the current value of p and the value of p at the end of the previous iteration. If the difference is less than eta_value, then the function terminates.The default value is 0.0001.
argument_clauses.description: For unsupervised learning, this argument specifies the tolerance of the termination criterion. At the end of each iteration, the function computes the difference between the current value of p and the value of p at the end of the previous iteration. If the difference is less than eta_value, then the function terminates.The default value is 0.0001.

argument_clauses.name: Mu
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the Type II (false positive) error, which occurs if a matched comparison is erroneously not linked. The default value is 0.9.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the Type II (false positive) error, which occurs if a matched comparison is erroneously not linked. The default value is 0.9.

argument_clauses.name: Lambda
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the Type I (false negative) error, which occurs if an unmatched comparison is erroneously linked. The default value is 0.9.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the Type I (false negative) error, which occurs if an unmatched comparison is erroneously linked. The default value is 0.9.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
